definition: net-like object/to hold sth in place with a net/to wind/to twist/(TCM) channels in the human body

sentences.english: Therefore, "Internet and media celebrities" to promote a blog is very powerful indeed.
sentences.chinese: 可見，“網絡紅人”的博客推廣確實很厲害。

sentences.english: No wonder the 'news raider' has become an overnight internet sensation.
sentences.chinese: 難怪這位“新聞闖客”會在一夜間成爲網絡紅人。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, it was chiefly celebrities and high-profile Web users who were concerned about their search results.
sentences.chinese: 曾經只有名人和網絡紅人才會關心他們的搜索結果。

definition: (originally) to provide assistance/(more recently) to show one's support (for a singing idol etc)
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
types of facial makeup in operas
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to make up and go on stage (idiom); to embark on a career (esp. in politics or crime)
